title: Microsoft continues expanding Azure Space
summary: Microsoft is continuing to expand its role in the space sector on multiple fronts with a strategy built around partnerships.

title: Bandwidth-hungry regional satellite operators hunting for options
summary: Regional satellite operators are searching for faster ways to add more capacity to their networks to meet soaring demand for broadband, according to executives speaking at World Satellite Business Week here.

title: AST SpaceMobile secures communications with prototype
summary: Direct-to-cell startup AST SpaceMobile is preparing to unfurl the largest commercial antenna ever deployed in low Earth orbit after establishing contact with its BlueWalker 3 prototype satellite.

title: Japan, Germany declare moratorium on anti-satellite missile tests
summary: Japan and Germany pledged this week not to conduct direct-ascent anti-satellite (ASAT) missile testing, throwing their weight behind the U.S.-driven initiative launched in April to promote peaceful and safe use of outer space.

title: Morpheus Space raises $28 million in Series A round
summary: Morpheus Space raised $28 million in a Series A funding round announced Sept. 14.

title: NASA science head to step down
summary: The NASA associate administrator responsible for the agency’s science programs will resign by the end of the year after more than six years on the job.

title: Blue Origin says still “super early” into New Shepard launch failure investigation
summary: A Blue Origin executive said it’s too soon to conclude what caused the failure of a New Shepard suborbital vehicle on a Sept. 12 flight, playing down any implications for the company’s New Glenn orbital rocket.

title: Iceye and Satlantis propose optical and radar satellite constellation
summary: Iceye announced preliminary plans Sept. 14 to work with Satlantis, a Spanish Earth-observation technology company, to launch a constellation of four satellites to acquire high-resolution radar and optical imagery.

title: Investors take long-term view of space industry amid near-term challenges
summary: Despite near-term headwinds in the economy and the markets, executives and investors remain bullish about the space industry’s long-term prospects.

title: Wireless communications startup repurposes technology from Google’s balloon internet project
summary: Aalyri Technologies, a startup that emerged from stealth mode Sept. 13, plans to provide high-speed internet using software and networking technology from Google’s ill-fated balloon project.
